intro: Neomartinella xingshanensis, commonly known as the Xingshan spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a waxy surface, while its flowers are inconspicuous, consisting of a cyathium structure. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
